text:
I haven't done Slack communities, but have been a part of and helped start a few Discord communities (a different vibe from Slack, but overall much of the same structure).

One piece of advice is that you are going to be tempted to create a million channels. But don't give in. Keep it simple, expand as the community grows, and shrink/cut channels as the community forms a more cohesive identity.

text:
I do a before so I'm not staring at a blank canvas when I go to write the actual MD after the article is complete.

The before just helps me feel like I am accomplishing something and keep momentum going (and to avoid having another blank space to fill in later).
